com.actinarium.rhythm.control

Class RhythmControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.actinarium.rhythm.control.RhythmControl

  • public final class RhythmControl
extends java.lang.Object

    A controller that interconnects RhythmGroups, RhythmFrameLayouts, and the Quick Control notification, and should be used as an entry point to accessing Rhythm library programmatically. For proper function a singleton Rhythm control must be accessible from ApplicationContext (i.e. the app’s Application object must implement RhythmControl.Host).

    Note: if you don’t need the notification or RhythmicFrameLayouts, you might actually not need a Rhythm control in your project — just instantiate and use RhythmGroups directly.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  RhythmControl.Host
      The Application must implement this interface to provide the singleton RhythmControl instance through its method RhythmControl.Host.getRhythmControl() to RhythmFrameLayouts and the Quick Control notification

    • Constructor Detail

      • RhythmControl

        public RhythmControl(@Nullable
                     android.content.Context context)
        Create a Rhythm control. Normally you shouldn’t create more than one Rhythm control in your application.
        Parameters:
        context - Current context (usually the Application object where Rhythm control setup is performed).
        You may actually set this to null if you don’t need the Quick Control notification.

    • Method Detail

      • makeGroup

        public RhythmGroup makeGroup(java.lang.String title)
        Make a new Rhythm group, registered in this Rhythm control
        Parameters:
        title - A convenient title for this group to identify it in the notification. Not mandatory (can be null) but recommended.
        Returns:
        The created Rhythm group instance, managed by this control

      • getGroup

        public RhythmGroup getGroup(int index)
        Get Rhythm group at requested index
        Parameters:
        index - index of the group (0, 1, 2... in order of adding)
        Returns:
        requested Rhythm group

      • getGroupCount

        public int getGroupCount()
        Returns:
        the number of groups registered in this control

      • showQuickControl

        public void showQuickControl(int notificationId)

        Show the “Quick Control” notification, which allows to switch overlays for all registered Rhythm groups quickly without navigating away from your app. Usually you would want to call this once during initial configuration (unless you don’t need the notification).

        Note: Quick Control notification is dismissible. Upon dismiss, all Rhythm overlays will be hidden. There’s no way to bring it back other than kill and restart the application, unless you explicitly create a button, a menu option etc in your application that would conjure the notification again by calling this method.

        Parameters:
        notificationId - ID for Rhythm notification, must be unique across the app
